content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.

```julia
using DataFrames

function audi_filter(df_cars)
    filtered_df = filter!(df_cars, manufacturer == "audi" & (model == "a4" | model == "a4 quattro"))
    filtered_df[!, :audi_a4_type] = true
    return filtered_df
end
```
This function takes the DataFrame `df_cars` as an input and returns a new DataFrame with columns `manufacturer`, `model`, and `audi_a4_type`. It first filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro” using the `filter!()` function. Then, it creates a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows using boolean indexing. Finally, the resulting DataFrame is returned.
